alert.note: Alert for Nacogdoches; Rusk; San Augustine; Shelby (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 17 at 8:34PM CDT until March 21 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Attoyac Bayou Near Chireno affecting San Augustine, Shelby, Rusk and Nacogdoches Counties. For the Attoyac Bayou...including Chireno...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON TO TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Attoyac Bayou Near Chireno. * WHEN...From Sunday afternoon to Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Expect lowland flooding for the next several days of the heavily wooded floodplain. Ranchers that have cattle and equipment near the river should move them to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM CDT Friday the stage was 12.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Sunday afternoon to a crest of 14.7 feet early Monday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.7 feet on 02/23/2012. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued Saturday evening at 845 PM CDT.
